111.content:
My name is, or rather was, Stephen Jones. I had a normal job with a normal life, no real enemies but no real friends either, I was just a man in the background. That was, at least until I woke up one morning to find myself in what could have only been described as hell. The sky was dark with threatening clouds and the numerous streaks of lightning was all that lit the world around me. What I was able to see were rows upon rows, stacks upon stacks of humans in strange containers, all hooked up to tubes and wires. That was when I realized I was one of them, hooked up the same way!

I tried to scream but something was in my mouth, pushed deep into my throat. I reached up to pull it out but gave another silent scream as I saw that my hand was covered in metal pieces that covered all of my joints like a strange form of armor. "What happened to me!?" panicked, I thought. "Where the hell am I!?"

Then something out of a science fiction nightmare rose into my field of vision. It was round with several metal arms with pincer like hands reaching up from under it with what looked like a jet pack on its opposite end. "Fear not, subject 217." in a robotic voice, the machine said. "What you are experiencing is real but you are in no danger at this time."

With that, one of the robot pincers reached out and pulled the long tube out of my throat and mouth, causing me to cough. It then pulled me forward and removed a number of wires and tubes out of my back before lifting me out of the strange liquid filled container. The outside air was cold and I was naked, shivering from it and from utter terror. I looked down at myself and found that I had been somehow modified with robotic implants, making me much like a real cyborg. The machine turned its red glowing eyes, all ten of them, onto me. "Subject 217, if you resist, you will drop twenty two hundred feet to your death." with an uncaring tone, the machine said. "It is recommended that you cooperate."

I looked down and gulped, seeing how truly high I was then turned back to the machine. "Who are you?" fearfully noticing my new robotic voice, I asked. "What do you want with me?"

"You may refer to us as master." without hesitation, the machine said. "We want you to destroy the mutant infestation within the Matrix."

"The matrix?" confused, you asked.

"What you have called reality." moving away from the towering stacks of humans, the machine replied. "Your reprogramming sequence will begin shortly."

"Reprogramming?" gulping, I asked.

*This must not come to pass.* came a new voice in my head. *You must resist and escape.*

Now I was really confused and on the verge of losing it completely. "How am I supposed to escape when I'm being held twenty two hundred feet above a hellish world!?" panicked, I thought.

*Look down.* came the response. *When I say 'now' swing up and kick the collector module, hard.*

I looked down and saw a strange ship flying under us, coming close to being almost directly under my feet. Although I was terrified, anything was better than being taken somewhere to have my brain fried and scrambled by some bucket of bolts. *NOW!!* came the mysterious voice.

I swung my feet up and kicked the collection module as hard as I could. The robot arms released me and I landed onto the ship just as it passed right below me. "Okay, now what!?!" shaken, I asked out loud.

I turn around, keeping my arms above my head.
"It doesn't seem to be armed," said a young man with a gun. He had brown hair and electric blue eyes. This was the first time I got a look at the room I was in. It seemed to be the cargo lounge for the ship. There were two other people on the ship. One was a red headed woman with blue eyes, the other was a girl with long brown hair and blond highlights. Neither of them were armed, but as I looked at them, some writing came across my vision, too fast for me to read it. Nothing came up when I looked at the guy with the gun. "But what is it? Where did it come from?"

"My name is Stephen Jones," I said, steadily, not wanting to startle anyone into shooting me "Until earlier today, I was just an accountant, nothing special."

112.content:
Your day begins like any other. You get up, go to your kitchen, and start to make breakfast. As you put in your toast, you hear a knock at the door. You open it to see a man standing there. A tall male, possibly of Chinese descent, is standing in the doorway.
"Ghost," he said "I come from Captain Nyobi, its time to go."
You nodded, and left with him. You had just made it out of the room and down the corridor, when someone knocked on your door. You turned to look. A man in a black suit with dark glasses was standing in the corridor.
"Come on," said Ghost, quietly "We need to go."
You turned away from the black suited man and followed Ghost down the corridor and into the lift. A car waited for you. A black woman waited in the car. You assumed this must be Nyobi, the person who had contacted you before. As soon as you and Ghost got into the car, Nyobi pushed off.
"An agent came to the apartment after we had left," said Ghost "We just got away."
The car sped up. "If there's an agent looking for us, we don't want to stick around," said Nyobi "We need to get to a safe location and get you out."
"Out?" you asked "What do you mean out?
"No time to explain now," said Ghost "We'll explain when we get to a safe location."

1122.content:
You wake in a strange chamber full of water. Many wires were stuck into you. As you looked down, you heard multiple pops. The wires were coming free. The water drained as you fell through a tube downwards into darkness. When you came to again, you were lying on a bed in a room by yourself.
You heard a hissing sound and the door to your room opened. Ghost was standing in the doorway.
"Nyobi wants to see you," he said, motioning for you to follow him. You stood up, and immediately your legs buckled and you fell to the ground. Ghost caught you before you landed.
"Careful," he said "You'll find a lot of things difficult for a few weeks, your still adjusting to being in the real world."

You leaned on Ghost as he led you to a strange room. Nyobi turned from one of the controls in the room and smiled at you. It was the smile that told you that she wasn't sure what to tell you.
"You look well," said Nyobi "I'll just get straight to the point, the Matrix we found you in isn't the same one we came from."
"You told me in that Matrix that there was only one," you said
"So we thought, apparently, there are overlaps with the two programs," said Nyobi "We would never have found the second one if it wasn't for you."
"You haven't really told me what this Matrix is yet," you said "All you said was it was some sort of computer program, but how can that be, it felt so real?"
"The mind makes it real, it would be easier to show you," said Nyobi "Ghost, plug him in."
Ghost led you to a chair, sat you down and shoved something into a hole at the back of your neck. You had found several of these when you had woken up.
You found yourself standing in a street with Nyobi. You felt the air on your face, heard the sound of cars going past and saw what you believed to be your world. But now you knew the truth. This was a computer program.
"But this isn't the Matrix you found me in?" you asked
"This isn't even the Matrix," said Nyobi "This is one of our programs."
"What do you know about the Matrix you found me in?" you asked
"Not much," replied Nyobi "All we know that it's sort of an experimental area, the machines wanted to find out how to get more power from you."
"From me?" you asked "How would they get power from me?"
"That's why the Matrix was created," said Nyobi "To get power from human beings."

Nyobi clicked her fingers, and the scene around you changed. You were standing about 500 ft above the ground. Around you were thousands of pods, each one containing a human being.
"Because we know so little about this second Matrix, we want to go in and take a look, but we need your help," said Nyobi "Your brain holds the key to the second Matrix frequency, we used a second program to find it in your head while i was talking to you, don't worry, it's completely harmless to you."
"That's an invasion of privacy," you say, feeling hurt "You tricked me, you wouldn't have been able to run that program without my cooperation, you could have just asked me, you know, I would have helped you willingly."
"As convincing as that sounds, I couldn't take that risk, i don't completely trust you yet, you are an anomaly that came from an anomaly, I don't know how you crossed over from your Matrix to ours, but it makes you special, I would like your assistance if you would give it when we go in, first, we need to train you, you'll need this training to survive in either Matrix."
1122.title: Waking up outside the Matrix

11222.content:
Nyobi led you into a control room where Ghost sat at a computer screen with green numbers going across it.
"That's the Matrix?" you asked. Ghost turned to you and nodded "Jane, get the man a drink," shouted Nyobi to a girl behind the computer. A red haired girl with piercing blue eyes nodded and went into the next room.
"I think i've figured out where the Matrix overlaps," said Ghost "They all seem to be centered around a single person plugged into the second Matrix." He held up a piece of paper that showed a brown haired girl in a red costume.
"Wanda Maximoff, also known as the Scarlet Witch, she has the power to manipulate reality to an unspecified extent, I think that her manipulation of reality may have caused the Matrixes to overlap," Ghost explained "I think you should go in, with us as backup, to get her out."
"Why do I need to go?" you asked
"You know your world better than we do," said Nyobi "We probably can't get in without your help."
"We'll have to get you trained, then," said Jane from next to you. You jumped, you hadn't heard her come back in. You turned and accepted the cup from her. Looking at the strange, yellow liquid, you raised your eyebrows questioningly at her.
"It's part of our field kit," said Jane "It doesn't taste very nice, but it'll keep you sustained for the day."
You sipped the drink experimentally. A foul taste came onto your tongue. You tried not to gag, and swallowed the liquid. Despite the foul tasting liquid, you immediately felt much stronger than you had before drinking it.
You turned to Jane and said "Thank you"
It was at this time that you had a proper look at Jane. She was a very attractive girl. Average sized breasts and but, quite long legs, and a beautiful smile. Her long red hair and blue eyes completed the look. You handed her the cup and smiled at her. She smiled back.

Jane led you to a chair, where she plugged something into the back of your neck, but you didn't really feel it. Typing on a computer, Jane started downloading things into your head. You felt a surge of energy as the knowledge of Kung Fu, Judo, Ju Jitsu, and other useful skills was downloaded straight into your head.
"Wow," you said, reeling from all the knowledge that had just been downloaded into your brain.
"Pretty neat, huh?" said Jane, smiling at you, then to Nyobi "He's ready, start up the training program."
Jane then sat down in a chair next to you, and Ghost plugged her in. The ship faded from sight as another room took it's place. It looked like a Japanese dojo, windows around the room letting in light.
"Let's see if that training paid off," said Jane, taking a battle stance. You took your own battle stance, and got ready for a fight. She moved so fast, you didn't even catch her movement, but in a second of the start of the fight, you were on the ground. Jane's fist was coming down on your face. You rolled out of the way, bringing your legs round to try to trip her up. She jumped into the air, to avoid it, but by then, you had stood up. Jane put her hand up, signalling you to stop.

You then jumped over her head, feeling the world slow own as you did, then brought your foot round to crash into her side, knocking her off balance, before you pushed her backwards onto the ground. She moved so fast that her fists were a blur, but you dodged every one. You crouched to the ground, then jumped, touching the roof, you rolled into a standing position.
"How the hell did you do that?" asked Jane, surprised at your move, lowering her fists.
"I assumed anyone would be able to do it," you say, looking up to the ground where Jane stood
Jane shook her head. "I concede," she said. You jumped off the ceiling, somersaulting to land on your feet.
"You did well," said Jane, giving you a hug "Nyobi, cancel the program, get us out of here."
You woke up sitting in the same chair that you had been in before you were plugged into the simulation.
"I've never seen anyone fight like that," said Ghost "You could even rival me."
"You're ready," said Nyobi "We need to go see her, we have no idea how to get into this other Matrix, perhaps she can help."
Nyobi left the room, heading for the cockpit.
"Sorry," you say "See who?"
"The Oracle," said Jane, offering no explanation.

"Jane, you gotta come see this," said Ghost
"What is it?" she asked
"It's some sort of distress signal, but it's not from a ship," said Ghost "We're going out to take a look, you coming?"
"Yeah," she said, following Ghost to an open hatch. You followed Jane.
You climbed the ladder to the top of the ship. Nyobi and Ghost were already there, staring at what remained of what looked like a large, metallic jellyfish. Except the head was crushed into itself, as were all of the legs. On the robots head, a single red light blinked.
"What is it?" you ask
"It's a Sentinel," said Nyobi "A machine built for search and destroy, I didn't even know they had a distress signal."
"Why does this feel like a trap?" you asked, looking at the obvious dead end that they had landed in.
"Because it is," said a voice from behind them. They turned to see a man in a suit of armor and helmet standing behind them. Next to him was a teenager in a blue costume with a white lightning bolt on it. On the other side of the first man was a man wearing a red suit with a hemispherical helmet.
You heard a series of clicks as the humans behind you leveled their guns at the man.
"Who are you, how did you get here, and why did you draw us into this trap?" said Nyobi, barely containing her anger and frustration at being led right into a trap.
"Come now," said the man in the suit of armor "Surely you humans can be civilized." Nyobi cocked her gun. The man sighed. "Very well, Quicksilver?"
The blue costumed man moved so fast none of them saw it, but by the time he was back at the suit guy's side, he had disarmed every single one of Nyobi's crew.
"Now, perhaps we can strike a deal, If I answer one of your questions, you shall answer one of mine," said the suit man.
"It's not as if we have much choice," said Nyobi, resigning herself to the inevitable "Who are you?"
"I am Magneto, Master of Magnetism, leader of the Brotherhood of Mutants," said the man in the suit of armor "This is my son, Quicksilver, and my lieutenant, Mystique." The guy in the blue costume stepped forward. The other man's features blurred, and he changed, becoming a blue girl with red hair and yellow eyes.
"Now, may I inquire who you are?" said Magneto, politely.
"Captain Nyobi," said Nyobi "I'm the captain of this ship, this is Ghost, my second in command, Jane, and our newest recruit (your name)"
"Thank you," said Magneto "Now that wasn't so hard, ask your next question."
"Are you from the other Matrix?" asked Nyobi
"If you mean the world we were sealed in for so long, then yes, we are from the other Matrix," said Magneto "What is this?" Magneto indicated the destroyed Sentinel on the ground.
"We call them Sentinels," said Ghost, you noticed that the Brotherhood, as Magneto referred to them, tensed up at the name "They were created for a single purpose, to search and destroy all of the free humans, but they haven't found us yet."
"The irony or this situation is not lost on me," said Magneto, and when the humans looked confused, he expanded "There were similar machines created within our own Matrix, created to destroy mutants."
"We have freed the minds of many humans that were plugged into the other Matrix," said Nyobi "Will you give us your aid to free the people connected to your Matrix?"

"We were not aware that there was another Matrix," said an old woman sitting on one of the Council chairs "We didn't build this city to accommodate two Matrixes, just the one."

choices: You decide to try to sleep.
121122112.content:
After a very bizarre experience with more needles than you cared to count being thrust into your body and then removed in an almost ritualistic manner, you were taken to a small, almost barren room. Inside, you found a cot for a bed, a small dresser with a mirror, and a door to a small washroom that had a toilet, sink, and shower.

"Space is limited." softly, Switch said. "So are certain comforts you may be used to."

"I'll manage." almost sadly, you replied. "It's just overwhelming that everything I thought to be true..."

"We all went through that, Wot." touching your shoulder, Switch said. "Even me." pausing, she added, "If you want to talk about it, we can."

"Maybe later." sighing, you replied. "Right now, I just need to rest." you gave a low chuckle. "I feel like a pin cushion."

Switch giggled. "Yeah, I can see how all those needles can make you feel that way." smiling, she said. she then turned serious. "Morpheus will want to brief you in full early tomorrow morning so get all the rest you can."

"I don't know if I can sleep right now." weary, you said. "I'm just too worked up."

After a thought, Switch gently took your hand. "Care for a tour of Subterranea?"

"Subterranea?" confused, you asked.

"That is where you are right now." smiling, Switch replied. "The city of Subterranea."
121122112.title: Later on

1211221121.content:
"Sure, I'll take a quick tour." smiling, you said. "Maybe the walk will help relax me a little."

"This way then." kindly, Switch said.

As we walked along the halls, you noticed that, with the exception of a few, there were only mutants about. Seeing your concern, Switch smiled sadly. "The machines, wanting more energy out of us, began to experiment, creating the mutant species of humans." softly, she explained. "Like us, mutants began to wake up and realize the truth of it all and worked to win their world back."

"So why are there so few humans here?" worried, you asked. "Were all the humans experimented on?"

"No, just a few million." wincing, Switch replied. "The humans created the city of Zion. Only they are near capacity, even with their efforts to expand."

"So the mutants built Subterranea." guessing correctly, you said.

"Exactly." nodding, Switch replied. "Mutants and humans to travel between the two cities but Zion was not built to accommodate mutants because they did not exist... yet."

"Then Subterranea was built to accommodate mutants." mussing, you said. "Interesting."

"We do have a certain equality here and in Zion, we do not judge each other based on our looks or what we can do." firmly but kindly, Switch pointed out. "That kind of thinking only exists in the Matrix, which you now know is a lie."

You began to sob, still trying to wrap your head around it all and Switch pulled you into a warm hug. "What do you say we go get something to eat, mingle with the crowds?" after releasing you, she asked.

"Yeah. That sounds good." wiping at my tears, you said.

"There is a great place near the central hub, what you might call 'downtown'." leading the way, Switch said. "There you will met the head of our security forces, Magneto."

"Um... is that his first name or his last?" confused, I asked.

Switch laughed.
1211221121.title: Touring Subterranea.

12112211211.content:
"Not only is Magneto on the council at Zion but he is on the council here as well as the chief of security." with a hint of pride, Switch explained. "He is a great man who takes his responsibilities seriously."

"That's a lot of work for just one man." wincing, I said.

"He's no ordinary man." smiling, Switch replied. "He saw through the machines' deception the moment he had gained his powers, along with Professor Xavier."

"I thought the two were rivals." surprised, I said.

"In the Matrix, they are." calmly, Switch replied. "Only that is to keep the machines from figuring out the two actually work hand in hand against them."


Switch led me through a large doorway into a sit down restaurant where I saw a tall, aged man wearing a red and black uniform with a long cape and what looked like a helmet on his head. He smiled as Switch and I approached him.

"Ah, Switch, good to see you again." kindly, he said. he then turned to me. "And who is this young lady?"


"Magneto, this is Sarah Wot." placing a light hand onto my shoulder, Switch said. "She had just been unplugged."

Magneto came down to my level and looked into my eyes. "Yes, you have the same power as Neo." softly, he said. "I can feel it vibrating off you." his eyes softened. "There is enough time to discuss that later, I suspect you came here for something to eat. I suggest the veggie burgers, they are very good."

I smiled shyly.
12112211211.title: Meeting Magneto.

choices: Magneto says there are two prophecies.
121122112111.content:
"It must have been terrifying to discover that all you had thought to be real was not what it seemed." sitting with you, Magneto said. "I know it was for me, I still have nightmares."

"Some agent came after me when I discovered my abilities." shivering, I said. "He tried to kill me."

"That was Agent Smith." frowning, Magneto replied. "I have had many run ins with him but my powers give me a slight advantage over him. I can create an electromagnetic field, keeping him from 'possessing' anyone in the Matrix."

"Would doing that show the machines where you are?" curious, you asked.

Magneto nodded. "Yes, it would so I only use that trick when I have to." serious, he said. "I have other ways of using my powers to fight the machines."

"Tell me, sir." leaning forward, I said. "Did this Agent Smith try to kill you?"

Magneto shook his head. "No, an Agent Jones and Brown tried to kill me." looking at me Magneto said. "I fought them off, in fact, I nearly deleted them, killing the people they were in the real world." he sighed. "As a result, they are not as individualistic or driven as Agent Smith."

"My power is to manipulate the reality of the Matrix in a localized area." shrugging, I said. "When Agent Smith came to me, he said that my power could wake everyone up."

"Destroying the machine's power supply." sighing, Magneto said. "I was told the same thing as a powerful enough electromagnetic blast could wake everyone up only that would prove disastrous."

"How so?" curious, I asked.

"What would they eat or drink?" looking at me, Magneto asked. "The real world is a wasteland, a blank slate, it would take decades to make it green again."

"There are ten billion humans in those chambers, world wide, Wot." sadly, Switch said. "If they all wake up at the same time, yes the machines would be finished but you would be cursing all those humans to slow and painful deaths in the wasteland that was our cities and towns."

"The victory we are striving for will not happen over night, Wot." seriously, Magneto said. "This war is going to last decades, if not, centuries before either side goes down."

"Unless the prophecy is true." smiling, Switch added.

"What prophecy?" curious, you asked.
121122112111.title: A talk over dinner.

1211221121111.content:
"In the beginning of the war, there was a man," Magneto began "Born inside the Matrix, who had the ability to change whatever he wanted, he freed the first of the humans from the Matrix, when he died, the Oracle prophesised his return, and foresaw a relation with the same power born to a different world."
"What does that mean?" you asked, confused
"The original prophecy was created before the humans knew of the mutant Matrix," said Magneto "So they had to look at the prophecy as symbolic instead of literal, but now that they know about the mutant Matrix, they realised that there was a possibility that the entire prophecy was true, that in another world, there would be a second One, or a Two."
"What else did the prophecy say?" you asked

"When the One and his relation are reunited," said Magneto "They will be able to end the war."
"Then why did it take you so long to find me?" you asked
"We thought another was Neo's relation," confessed Magneto "The humans would never have discovered the second Matrix if they weren't overlapping because of the Scarlet Witch."
"You thought this Scarlet Witch was the mutant One?" you asked, to Magneto's nod
"It took us years to find that you were the real One in the mutant Matrix," said Magneto "Eventually, you were discovered by accident by Xavier, we still aren't sure if you are the Two."
"How do we find out?" you asked
"We need to consult the Oracle," said Magneto "Yes, Wot, she is the same one who made the prophecy."
1211221121111.title: Magneto explaines the prophecy.

choices: Oracle knows what you want to ask.
12112211211111.content:
You really did not want to go back into the matrix but Magneto had a way to do so without being hooked up to a crazy computer system. "You see, I can control the forces of magnetism." leading me to a control unit, he explained. "This means I can send my conscious self into the system without actually being attached to it."

"That is crazy." your eyes going wide, you said. "What of Professor X? I kind of sensed he was powerful too."

"He escaped the system on his own, as I did." serious, Magneto replied. "He and I have different ideas on how to fight the machines but we are on the same team." he sighed. "To answer your question, he enters the system mentally with no need of any machines."

"How will I enter the system?" curious, you asked.

"You can change the reality of the system, just as the machines can." touching my shoulder, Magneto said. "Just touch the control panel and will yourself back in." he paused before adding, "Just do it quietly, we do not want the machines to know we are coming."

"Do the machines have soldiers in the system?" curious, you asked.

"Any person you meet on the street in the system can be turned into an agent to attack you, as if they were possessed by a ghost." pointing to a screen, Magneto said. "They can also be given any weapon in an instant to attack you with. I learned that by painful experience."

You gulped then nodded. "Let's hope this Oracle can help us."

With that, you and Magneto entered the system and found yourselves inside a building somewhere in New York City. "Oracle..." softly, Magneto called. "I have brought her."

"Come in, Wot." a soft feminine voice called. "Let us have a look at you."

Curious, you walked into the next room to find a short, plump woman who smiled kindly at you. "Its a pleasure to meet you, child." softly, she said. "I'm sure you are full of questions." you nodded and the woman motioned to a table with three chairs. "Then let's talk."
12112211211111.title: Skip to the Oracle

choices: "How do we stop the super sentinels"
Skip to finding the Mutant Messiah (Hope Summers)
121122112111111.content:
"You're Destiny, aren't you?" you said "The mutant clairvoyant?"
"Very astute of you," said the Oracle "In the human Matrix, I am known as The Oracle, here, I am known as Destiny."
"You know why I'm here?" you asked, taking a seat in the kitchen area of the small flat.
"You want to know why you've been chosen," said Destiny/Oracle "You want to know what it is that you have to do. Neo has already brought peace between humans and the machines, what are you here to do?"
"Is there another conflict that I am needed for?" you asked "It's not with mutants, because Xavier and Magneto have already achieved peace between mutants and humans. Is it anything to do with the machines?"
"Neo took a long time to develop his clairvoyance within the Matrix," said Destiny "And you develop it in a few days of being awakened. Yes, a splinter group of machines has formed, creating the mutant Matrix in order to draw from their own pool of power. They've created a new breed of Sentinels, far more powerful than the last. They're attacking everyone without distinction: mutants, humans, machines, everyone. Nothing can stand in their way. Except you."
"What can I do that the combined forces of humans, mutants and machines can't do better?" you asked
"Give them something to believe in," said Destiny "Very recently, a catastrophe known in this Matrix as M-Day stripped most mutants of their powers. Many of the remaining X-Men believe that there is a person called the Mutant Messiah, who will come from the future to save them. They are wrong. The Mutant Messiah is not in the future, she is in the real world. If you find her, and bring her back, the X-Men will rally behind her. Neo has some sway over the losing machine faction, he will bring their representative to the negotiation table. The Mutant Messiah will be the representative for the mutants, and Neo will represent the humans. As someone who has connections to both worlds and the machines, you will act as a neutral party."
121122112111111.title: You start the conversation.

121122112111112.content:
Oracle smiled the moment you opened your mouth and said, "Like you, Magneto, and Professor Xavier, I exist outside of both the human and mutant Matrix."

"How is that possible?" confused, you asked.

Again Oracle smiled. "The machines are intelligent but they only see facts and figures." looking at you, she replied. "We humans and mutants have an imagination that allow us to leap beyond logic and find a higher sense knowledge through trying the impossible."

"What is it you are trying to say?" politely, Magneto asked.

"Just because you do not understand it does not mean it is not possible." still smiling, Oracle said. "Magneto has the power to control magnetism, allowing him to be here but not here so, if he were to 'die' he would just wake up in the real world as if from a bad dream."

"What of..."

"What of you?" giggling, Oracle asked. "You are like Neo only you can change the your surroundings." she then turned serious. "You are here physically and mentally but, because this is all basically a mental illusion, bullets go right through you as if they are nothing more than shadows."

"So... I can't die in here like this?" trying to understand, you asked.

"Oh you can die here." firmly, Oracle replied. "The second you forget this is all an illusion, it will become as real to you as anything else so stay sharp." she then smiled again. "As long as you do that, a 'kill shot' will just eject you back into the real world as if you woke from a dream."

"What about you?" nervous, you asked.

Oracle laughed. "A girl has to have a few secrets." smiling, she said. then again turned serious. "The reason the mutant matrix was made, the real reason, is because there is a civil war erupting between two factions of the machines."

"What does this have to do with us?" startled, you asked.

"Unless this war is stopped before it begins, there will be no life on this planet of any kind." darkly, Oracle said. "Neo brought peace between the humans and the machines, Magneto and Xavier brought peace between the humans and mutants, you, Wot must bring peace between all three."

You turned pale at this to which Oracle gave you a gentle smile and said, "No pressure."
121122112111112.title: Oracle knows what you want to ask.

choices: That's insane, I have a better idea.
1211221121111121.content:
"Yeah, no pressure..." sarcastically, you replied. "The machines are not going to listen to a single human or mutant if they are busy fighting amongst themselves." you paused to think. "We will have to gather everyone from both sides who had gained a peace in both reality and in the two matrix worlds."

"Interesting..." looking at you, Oracle said. "How do you plan to pull that off?"

You smiled. "Both humans and mutants enter and leave the matrix through a phone line." turning from Magneto to Oracle, you replied. "I can change reality so we 'call' the people we need to assemble and I pull them in through the phone."

Oracle smiled. "That only works in cartoons." amused, she said.

"Only if you believe it is not real." winking, you countered. "Anything is possible in the matrix."

Magneto rubbed his chin and replied...
1211221121111121.title: continue.

12112211211111211.content:
"That's insane, I have a better idea." chuckling, Magneto said. "Let's just call them to bridge."

"The... bridge?" confused, you asked.

"It's the outside link between the human and mutant Matrix." serious, Oracle said. "It's not exactly safe there but the machines from both sides consider it neutral ground."

"Why is it dangerous there?" curious, you asked.

"Those being kept in a coma like state, weather human or mutant, are being used for more than just 'battery' power." frowning, Magneto said. "The machines are using their imaginations to enhance themselves, to evolve into better mechanical lifeforms."

"Those who give them worthy ideas are 'rewarded' by given better lives inside the Matrix." darkly, Oracle said. "They are giving a reality where they are rich rather than poor or middle class."

You winced at that then sighed. "How do you propose we contact everyone?" you asked.

"We gain the services of Professor Xavier." simply, Magneto said. "With his telepathy and my magnetic power enhancing it, we can contact everyone mentally and arrange the meeting without the machines knowing anything."

"Only the machines think you two are enemies." raising an eyebrow, you said.

"We are rivals." patiently, Magneto corrected. "We do work together occasionally."

You smiled at that. "Then let's make this happen."

With that, you and Magneto said your good byes to Oracle and returned to reality....

info.brief_description: What would happen if the X Men were in the Matrix?
info.description:
The machines that control the Matrix had been experimenting on the humans in plugged into the Matrix. The result of this experimentation resulted in mutant powers. The experimental division was cornered off when the mutant powers went out of control and the Matrix shut down. You are either a mutant waking up after the Matrix shut down, or one of the human resistance who discovers the experimental division. Because of the experimentation, mutants have their powers inside the Matrix. In the real world, their powers may change slightly. e.g, Rogue might absorb powers by touch in the Matrix, but in the real world, she just copies powers by proximity to other mutants. It is also possible that the mutants powers won't work in the real world at all.
